conclusion: Analyze the direction of liquid flow as it passes through each baffle to determine which container it will flow into.
Baffle A: The liquid flows horizontally from left to right.
Baffle B: The liquid flows diagonally from top-left to bottom-right.
Baffle C: The liquid flows horizontally from left to right.
Baffle D: The liquid flows diagonally from top-right to bottom-left.
Baffle A: The liquid exits on the right side.
Baffle B: The liquid exits on the bottom-right corner.
Baffle C: The liquid exits on the right side.
Baffle D: The liquid exits on the bottom-left corner.
Container E: Located at the bottom-left corner.
Container F: Located in the middle.
Container G: Located at the bottom-right corner.
Liquid exiting from Baffle B (bottom-right corner) will flow into Container G.
Liquid exiting from Baffle D (bottom-left corner) will flow into Container E.
Liquid exiting from Baffle A and Baffle C (right side) will flow into Container F.
Final Answer: The liquid will flow into Containers E, F, and G respectively.
